summary: This document is an FBI interview summary (302) of a female witness, referred to as AUSA DOB, detailing her interactions with Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and their associates. She describes meeting Epstein through David Blaine, traveling to Epstein's properties, and experiencing sexual assault by Epstein during massages. The document also includes her observations of Maxwell's behavior and conversations with Ron Burkle about Epstein's activities.

persons.name: AUSA DOB
persons.context: The primary interviewee, a model who describes meeting Jeffrey Epstein through David Blaine, traveling to his properties, and being sexually assaulted by him during massages.

persons.name: David Blaine
persons.context: Introduced the witness to Jeffrey Epstein at a night club in New York and took her to Epstein's New York mansion. The witness categorizes him as one of the 'weird creepy slimeballs' but the 'nicest one'.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure, described as a mentor and perpetrator who sexually assaulted the witness multiple times during massages. He arranged travel, provided career advice, and hosted the witness at various properties.

persons.name: Naomi Campbell
persons.context: Present at a dinner at Epstein's New York mansion where the witness first met Epstein.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Epstein's associate who encouraged the witness and her sister to be more sexual, discussed masturbation, and acted as a 'ringleader for girls'. She was present in New Mexico, Palm Beach, and New York.

persons.name: Ron Burkle
persons.context: Met by the witness on Epstein's island. Told the witness that Epstein earned money from having sex with Les Wexner and made negative comments about Epstein and Prince Andrew.

persons.name: Les Wexner
persons.context: Mentioned by Ron Burkle as the person from whom Epstein earned money through a sexual relationship.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned by Ron Burkle in connection with flying on Epstein's plane and having orgies with Epstein.

persons.name: David Copperfield
persons.context: Met by the witness and her sister in Las Vegas; the witness inferred he and Epstein were friends.

connections.description: Blaine introduced the witness to Epstein and facilitated her initial entry into Epstein's social circle.
Blaine introduced the witness to Epstein, indicating a social connection between them.
Epstein sexually assaulted the witness multiple times during massages and acted as a mentor figure to her.
Maxwell encouraged the witness and her sister to be more sexual, had conversations about masturbation, and acted as a facilitator within Epstein's circle.
Maxwell worked with Epstein, arranging travel and interacting with the girls in his circle; the witness could not figure out the exact nature of their relationship.
Burkle was present on Epstein's island and made disparaging comments about Epstein's activities and relationship with Les Wexner and Prince Andrew.
According to Ron Burkle, Epstein earned all his money from having sex with Les Wexner.
According to Ron Burkle, Epstein and Prince Andrew would fly on Epstein's plane and have orgies.

events.title: Initial Meeting with Epstein
events.description: The witness, then approximately 18, was introduced to Jeffrey Epstein by David Blaine at a dinner at Epstein's New York mansion, which was also attended by Naomi Campbell.

events.title: New Year's Trip to Private Island
events.description: The witness was contacted to go to Epstein's private island for New Year's. She traveled there, met other individuals including Ron Burkle, and stayed in a bungalow.

events.title: New Mexico Trip with Sister
events.description: The witness and her underage sister met Epstein in Las Vegas and flew on his jet to New Mexico. There, Ghislaine Maxwell had sexual conversations with them, encouraging them to be more comfortable with sexual topics.

events.title: Sexual Assault During Massage
events.description: Epstein sexually assaulted the witness when she gave him a massage, an event that happened multiple times. He would pay her $200 for the massages.

events.title: Revelation from Another Girl
events.description: At the end of the New Mexico trip, another girl told the witness, 'Oh you brought your sister here so he could do his thing,' which was the first time the witness thought something was off.

events.title: Conversation with Ron Burkle
events.description: Ron Burkle told the witness that Epstein earned money from having sex with Les Wexner and made negative comments about Epstein and Prince Andrew's activities.

keyFacts: The witness was sexually assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein multiple times during massages, for which he paid her $200.
Ghislaine Maxwell encouraged the witness and her underage sister to be more sexual, discussing masturbation and using hot tub jets.
The witness brought her underage sister to New Mexico after Epstein said it was 'fine,' and later a girl implied the sister was brought there for Epstein's purposes.
Ron Burkle claimed Epstein earned all his money from having sex with Les Wexner and that Epstein and Prince Andrew would have orgies on Epstein's plane.
The witness's interactions with Epstein and Maxwell lasted over a year before fading out after the first lawsuit against Epstein happened.
